sense.name: the extreme endpoint of something
sense.examples: Bob pressed the tips of his fingers together. They have a vacation home along the southern tip of the peninsula.

sense.name: the summit or top of something
sense.examples: From the tip of Mount Shasta we could see for miles. Some analysts think we are now at the tip of the bull market. (metaphoric)

sense.name: small sum of money given as gratuity
sense.examples: John gave the waiter a generous tip. Are we supposed to give the doorman a tip? She makes almost have her income in tips.

sense.name: confidential advice
sense.examples: My broker gave me a hot tip about a new energy stock. The young pitcher got a couple of tips from his older teammate. We appreciated the tip about John's drinking problem.

sense.name: something shaped like a peak or point
sense.examples: These cannibals file their teeth into tips. He keeps a box of tips in his desk draw for his fountain pen.

sense.name: the act of tilting something
sense.examples: With a tip of the bottle, she poured a drink into the cup. The man bowed to the ladies with a tip of his hat.

sense.name: a light push or shove
sense.examples: The child gave a slight tip of his hand to knock down the house of playing cards. A gentle tip is apparently all it took to topple the team's confidence. (metaphoric)

sense.name: eluding recall
sense.examples: His name was on the tip of my tongue.

sense.name: small perceptible portion of a larger issue, problem
sense.examples: That accounting error on the books turned out to be the tip of the iceberg.
